canonical_explanation.text: The Mid-point Theorem states that the line segment joining the mid-points of two sides of a triangle is parallel to the third side and equal to half its length. If D and E are mid-points of sides AB and AC of triangle ABC respectively, then DE || BC and DE = (1/2)BC. The converse states that if a line through the mid-point of one side is parallel to another side, it bisects the third side. The Equal Intercept Theorem states that three or more parallel lines make equal intercepts on any transversal if they make equal intercepts on one transversal.
rules: Mid-point Theorem: Line joining mid-points of two sides is parallel to third side and half its length
Converse: Line through mid-point parallel to one side bisects the third side
Equal Intercept Theorem: Parallel lines making equal intercepts on one transversal make equal intercepts on all transversals
Applications require identifying mid-points, parallel lines, and applying proportionality

questions.question_text: In triangle ABC, if D and E are mid-points of AB and AC respectively, then DE is:

options.text: Parallel to BC and equal to BC
Parallel to BC and equal to (1/2)BC
Perpendicular to BC and equal to (1/2)BC
Parallel to BC and equal to 2BC

questions.question_text: The line joining the mid-points of two sides of a triangle is always parallel to the third side.
If D and E are mid-points of sides AB and AC of triangle ABC, and BC = 12 cm, then DE = _____ cm.
In triangle PQR, M and N are mid-points of PQ and PR respectively. If QR = 8.6 cm, what is the length of MN?
In triangle ABC, D and E are mid-points of AB and AC. If DE = 5x - 3 and BC = 4x + 10, then x = _____.
If a line through the mid-point of one side of a triangle is parallel to another side, it must bisect the third side.
The converse of the mid-point theorem states that:

options.text: A line parallel to one side of a triangle divides the other two sides proportionally
A line through the mid-point of one side parallel to another side bisects the third side
The mid-points of sides of a triangle form a smaller triangle
Parallel lines are always equal in length

questions.question_text: In triangle ABC, D, E, F are mid-points of BC, CA, AB respectively. If the perimeter of triangle ABC is 48 cm, what is the perimeter of triangle DEF?
The Equal Intercept Theorem applies only to three parallel lines.
If three parallel lines make equal intercepts on one transversal, they make _____ intercepts on any other transversal.
In triangle XYZ, P and Q are mid-points of XY and XZ respectively. If PQ = 7.5 cm, then YZ equals:
In a quadrilateral ABCD, P, Q, R, S are mid-points of AB, BC, CD, DA respectively. If AC = 10 cm and BD = 14 cm, and AC is perpendicular to BD, then the perimeter of PQRS is _____ cm.
In triangle ABC, D is the mid-point of AB. A line through D parallel to BC meets AC at E. If AC = 16 cm, then AE equals:
Three parallel lines l, m, n cut off equal intercepts AB = BC = 5 cm on a transversal. If another transversal cuts these lines at P, Q, R with PQ = 3x + 2, then QR = _____.
If D, E, F are mid-points of sides BC, CA, AB of triangle ABC respectively, then the area of triangle DEF is one-fourth the area of triangle ABC.
ABCD is a parallelogram. P, Q, R, S are mid-points of AB, BC, CD, DA respectively. What type of quadrilateral is PQRS?
Arrange the steps to prove that the line joining mid-points of two sides of a triangle is parallel to the third side:
ordering_items: Let D and E be mid-points of AB and AC in triangle ABC
Draw a line through E parallel to AB meeting BC at F
Prove that D and F coincide using congruent triangles
Conclude that DE is parallel to BC
correct_answer: Let D and E be mid-points of AB and AC in triangle ABC
Draw a line through E parallel to AB meeting BC at F
Prove that D and F coincide using congruent triangles
Conclude that DE is parallel to BC

questions.question_text: In triangle PQR, M is the mid-point of PQ. A line through M parallel to QR intersects PR at N. If PR = 18 cm and PN = 9 cm, then N is the _____ of PR.

Four parallel lines are cut by two transversals. If the intercepts on one transversal are 2 cm, 2 cm, and 2 cm, and the first intercept on the second transversal is 3 cm, what is the second intercept on the second transversal?
The figure formed by joining the mid-points of the sides of any quadrilateral is always a parallelogram.
If in triangle ABC, DE joins mid-points of AB and AC, and angle ABC = 70 degrees, then angle ADE equals:
In an isosceles triangle ABC with AB = AC, D and E are mid-points of AB and AC. If BC = 10 cm and DE = 5 cm, then triangle ADE is _____ to triangle ABC.

Five parallel lines are intersected by two transversals. On the first transversal, the intercepts are all equal to 4 cm. If the total length intercepted on the second transversal is 24 cm, what is each intercept on the second transversal?
Arrange the steps to prove that the quadrilateral formed by joining mid-points of any quadrilateral is a parallelogram:
ordering_items: Let P, Q, R, S be mid-points of sides AB, BC, CD, DA of quadrilateral ABCD
Apply mid-point theorem in triangles ABC and ADC
Show PQ parallel to SR and PS parallel to QR
correct_answer: Let P, Q, R, S be mid-points of sides AB, BC, CD, DA of quadrilateral ABCD
Apply mid-point theorem in triangles ABC and ADC
Show PQ parallel to SR and PS parallel to QR

questions.question_text: The line joining the mid-points of two sides of a triangle divides the triangle into two equal areas.
In triangle ABC, D, E, F are mid-points of BC, CA, AB respectively. If AB = 8 cm, BC = 10 cm, AC = 12 cm, then the perimeter of triangle DEF is _____ cm.
In triangle LMN, P is the mid-point of LM. Through P, a line parallel to MN is drawn which meets LN at Q. If LN = 20 cm, what is LQ?
ABCD is a rectangle with AB = 12 cm and BC = 9 cm. P, Q, R, S are mid-points of AB, BC, CD, DA respectively. What is the area of quadrilateral PQRS?
The Equal Intercept Theorem is applicable when:
If D and E are mid-points of sides AB and AC of triangle ABC, then triangle ADE is similar to triangle ABC with a scale factor of 1:2.
In triangle ABC, D is the mid-point of AB and E is a point on AC such that DE is parallel to BC. If AC = 24 cm and EC = 12 cm, then E is the _____ of AC.
In a right-angled triangle ABC with right angle at B, if D and E are mid-points of AB and BC, then DE is _____ to AC.
If three parallel lines make intercepts of 3 cm, 4 cm, 3 cm on one transversal, they will make unequal intercepts on another transversal.
Arrange the steps to find the perimeter of the triangle formed by joining mid-points of the sides of a given triangle:
ordering_items: Identify the mid-points D, E, F of sides BC, CA, AB
Apply mid-point theorem: DE = (1/2)AB, EF = (1/2)BC, FD = (1/2)CA
Calculate the sum DE + EF + FD
Conclude: Perimeter of DEF is half the perimeter of ABC
correct_answer: Identify the mid-points D, E, F of sides BC, CA, AB
Apply mid-point theorem: DE = (1/2)AB, EF = (1/2)BC, FD = (1/2)CA
Calculate the sum DE + EF + FD
Conclude: Perimeter of DEF is half the perimeter of ABC

questions.question_text: In triangle ABC, D and E are mid-points of AB and AC. If the area of triangle ABC is 80 sq cm, what is the area of quadrilateral BCED?
The converse of the mid-point theorem is used to prove that a point is a _____ of a side.
Three parallel lines cut two transversals AB and CD at points P, Q, R and X, Y, Z respectively. If PQ = 4 cm, QR = 4 cm, and XY = 5 cm, then YZ equals:
If ABCD is a rhombus and P, Q, R, S are mid-points of its sides, then PQRS is a rectangle.
In triangle PQR, if M and N are mid-points of PQ and PR, and angle Q = 50 degrees and angle R = 60 degrees, then angle MNR = _____ degrees.
Arrange the steps to prove the converse of the mid-point theorem:
ordering_items: Given: D is mid-point of AB and DE is parallel to BC
Assume E is not the mid-point of AC
Let E' be the mid-point of AC
By mid-point theorem, DE' is parallel to BC
This contradicts the uniqueness of parallel lines, so E must coincide with E'
correct_answer: Given: D is mid-point of AB and DE is parallel to BC
Assume E is not the mid-point of AC
Let E' be the mid-point of AC
By mid-point theorem, DE' is parallel to BC
This contradicts the uniqueness of parallel lines, so E must coincide with E'

questions.question_text: In trapezium ABCD with AB parallel to DC, P and Q are mid-points of AD and BC respectively. If AB = 16 cm and DC = 10 cm, what is PQ?
In an equilateral triangle ABC with side 12 cm, D and E are mid-points of AB and AC. What is the perimeter of triangle ADE?
If in triangle ABC, D is the mid-point of AB and a line through D parallel to AC meets BC at E, then BE = EC.
Six parallel lines make five equal intercepts of 3 cm each on one transversal. The total length intercepted on any other transversal, if the first intercept is 2 cm, is _____ cm.
ABCD is a square with side 8 cm. P, Q, R, S are mid-points of AB, BC, CD, DA. What is the length of diagonal PR of quadrilateral PQRS?

In triangle ABC, D, E, F are mid-points of sides BC, CA, AB. If the area of triangle ABC is 96 sq cm, then the area of triangle formed by joining the centroids of triangles AEF, FBD, and DEC is _____ sq cm.
What is the their correct conclusions: of D and E are mid-points of AB and AC?
What is the their correct conclusions: of DE = 6 cm and DE is half of BC?
What is the their correct conclusions: of Mid-point theorem application?
What is the their correct conclusions: of Triangle with all mid-points joined?
What is the statement: of Mid-point Theorem?

options.text: Mid-points of quadrilateral sides form a parallelogram
Line joining mid-points is parallel and half the third side
Parallel lines make equal intercepts on transversals
Line through mid-point parallel to a side bisects the third side

questions.question_text: What is the statement: of Converse of Mid-point Theorem?

options.text: Line through mid-point parallel to a side bisects the third side
Parallel lines make equal intercepts on transversals
Line joining mid-points is parallel and half the third side
Mid-points of quadrilateral sides form a parallelogram

questions.question_text: What is the statement: of Equal Intercept Theorem?

options.text: Line through mid-point parallel to a side bisects the third side
Line joining mid-points is parallel and half the third side
Mid-points of quadrilateral sides form a parallelogram
Parallel lines make equal intercepts on transversals

questions.question_text: What is the statement: of Application?

options.text: Line joining mid-points is parallel and half the third side
Line through mid-point parallel to a side bisects the third side
Mid-points of quadrilateral sides form a parallelogram
Parallel lines make equal intercepts on transversals

questions.question_text: How many does Rectangle have?
How many does Rhombus have?
How many does Square have?
How many does Any quadrilateral have?
What is the value of Three parallel lines with equal intercepts on one transversal?
What is the value of Four parallel lines with first two intercepts equal?
What is the value of Parallel lines with unequal intercepts on one transversal?
What is the value of Equal intercepts on two different transversals?
